reasoning: Giant cell myocarditis (GCM) is a rare fulminant form of myocarditis, representing <1% of all myocarditis cases. Global myocarditis incidence ~1-4 per 100k, with GCM at lower end ~0.05 per 100k based on autopsy and biopsy studies.
source: Cooper LT et al. (2009). The role of endomyocardial biopsy in the management of cardiovascular disease: a scientific statement from the American Heart Association. Circulation. 116(19):2216-2233
